questions.question: Which of the following is an irrational number?
questions.explanation: π is an irrational number because it cannot be expressed as a simple fraction and its decimal representation is non-terminating and non-repeating.

questions.question: Express 0.00045 in standard form.
questions.explanation: Standard form is a x 10ⁿ where 1 ≤ a < 10.  0.00045 = 4.5 x 10⁻⁴.

questions.question: Simplify: x³ × x⁵
questions.explanation: When multiplying terms with the same base, add the exponents: x³ × x⁵ = x^(3+5) = x⁸.

questions.question: Which of these numbers is irrational?
questions.explanation: √2 cannot be written as a terminating or repeating decimal, making it irrational.

questions.question: Write 67000 in standard form.
questions.explanation: To write in standard form, move the decimal point until there's one non-zero digit to the left, then multiply by 10 raised to the power of how many places you moved the decimal.

questions.question: Simplify: (y⁷) / y²
questions.explanation: When dividing terms with the same base, subtract the exponents: y⁷ / y² = y^(7-2) = y⁵.

questions.question: What is the value of 5⁻²?
questions.explanation: A negative exponent indicates a reciprocal: 5⁻² = 1/5² = 1/25.

questions.question: Which of the following is closest to the value of √10?
questions.explanation: 3.1² = 9.61 and 3.2² = 10.24, so 3.2 is the closest to √10.

questions.question: Express 0.0000032 in standard form.
questions.explanation: Move the decimal point 6 places to the right to get 3.2, so the exponent is -6.

questions.question: Simplify: a² × a⁻³
questions.explanation: When multiplying terms with the same base, add the exponents: a² × a⁻³ = a^(2-3) = a⁻¹.

questions.question: Which of the following is an irrational number?
questions.explanation: While 22/7 is an approximation of π, √2 is inherently irrational.

questions.question: Write 4.8 x 10⁻³ as an ordinary number.
questions.explanation: Moving the decimal point 3 places to the left gives 0.0048.

questions.question: Simplify: (b¹⁰) / (b⁴ × b²)
questions.explanation: (b¹⁰) / (b⁴ × b²) = b¹⁰ / b⁶ = b^(10-6) = b⁴.

questions.question: Estimate the value of √20 to the nearest whole number.
questions.explanation: 4² = 16 and 5² = 25. 20 is closer to 16, so √20 is approximately 4.

questions.question: Express 5670000 in standard form.
questions.explanation: Move the decimal point 6 places to the left to get 5.67, so the exponent is 6.

questions.question: Which of the following is an irrational number?
questions.explanation: √17 cannot be expressed as a simple fraction and has a non-terminating, non-repeating decimal representation.

questions.question: Write 0.000056 in standard form.
questions.explanation: Move the decimal point 5 places to the right to get 5.6, so the exponent is -5.

questions.question: Estimate the value of √30 to the nearest whole number.
questions.explanation: 5² = 25 and 6² = 36. 30 is closer to 25, so √30 is approximately 5.

questions.question: Express 123450000 in standard form.
questions.explanation: Move the decimal point 7 places to the left to get 1.2345, so the exponent is 8.

questions.question: Which of the following is an irrational number?
questions.explanation: √3 cannot be expressed as a simple fraction and has a non-terminating, non-repeating decimal representation.

questions.question: Write 0.00000078 in standard form.
questions.explanation: Move the decimal point 7 places to the right to get 7.8, so the exponent is -7.

questions.question: Simplify: (q¹²) / (q⁵ × q³)
questions.explanation: (q¹²) / (q⁵ × q³) = q¹² / q⁸ = q^(12-8) = q⁴.

questions.question: Estimate the value of √60 to the nearest whole number.
questions.explanation: 7² = 49 and 8² = 64. 60 is closer to 64, so √60 is approximately 8.

questions.question: Express 987654321 in standard form (to 3 significant figures).
questions.explanation: Rounding to 3 significant figures gives 9.88, and the exponent is 8.

questions.question: What is the value of 5⁰?
questions.explanation: Any non-zero number raised to the power of 0 is equal to 1.

questions.question: Which of the following is an irrational number?
questions.explanation: √11 cannot be expressed as a simple fraction and has a non-terminating, non-repeating decimal representation.

questions.question: Write 0.00234 in standard form.
questions.explanation: Move the decimal point 3 places to the right to get 2.34, so the exponent is -3.

questions.question: Simplify: (s¹⁵) / (s⁷ × s⁻¹)
questions.explanation: (s¹⁵) / (s⁷ × s⁻¹) = s¹⁵ / s⁶ = s^(15-6) = s⁹.

questions.question: Estimate the value of √85 to the nearest whole number.
questions.explanation: 9² = 81 and 10² = 100. 85 is closer to 81, so √85 is approximately 9.
